page.title: 02WHITKIRK AND CROSSGATES 2
page.content:
In the SW corner is the small village of{Colton,}which borders onto {Templenewsam Park.}There are two farms in the village and a small school. In the last year Colton has more than doubled in size with the building of the new{Colton Village Estate.
Before the Industrial Revolution, {Whitkirk,}an old village on top of a hill clustered round the medieval church of Saint Mary's, was the centre of the area, but the coming of the railway led to{Crossgates}becoming the focal point. It is now the main shopping centre of the area.
A number of old buildings survive in Whitkirk. As well as the church there is the old manor house and a number of other smaller houses.
